definitions.definition: To pronounce the consonant ‘s’ imperfectly ; to give ‘s’ and ‘z’ the sounds of ‘th’ ( /θ/ , /ð/ ). This is a speech impediment common among children.
examples: Until the age of 10, Dominic would lisp , but this was fixed by a speech therapist.

definitions.definition: To speak with imperfect articulation ; to mispronounce , such as a child learning to talk .
To speak hesitatingly and with a low voice, as if afraid.
to express by the use of simple, childlike language.
To speak with reserve or concealment ; to utter timidly or confidentially .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To pronounce the consonant ‘s’ imperfectly ; to give ‘s’ and ‘z’ the sounds of ‘th’ ( /θ/ , /ð/ ). This is a speech impediment common among children.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To speak with imperfect articulation ; to mispronounce , such as a child learning to talk .
( intransitive , archaic ) To speak hesitatingly and with a low voice, as if afraid.
( intransitive , archaic ) to express by the use of simple, childlike language.
( intransitive , archaic ) To speak with reserve or concealment ; to utter timidly or confidentially .
